title: Research
text:
Current Projects

“War Fatigue” with Aaron Erlich & Dietlind Stolle.
“Civic Engagement in Rebuilding Ukraine: Observational and Experimental Evidence” with Aaron Erlich & Dietlind Stolle.



Under Review

“Housing, Healthcare, and More: Decoding the 2022 Ontario General Election” Under Review in The Canadian Political Science Review, with Andrea Perrella & Simon Kiss.

title: Rafael Campos-Gottardo
text:
I am a Masters student in the political science department at McGill University and the Centre for the Study of Democratic Citizenship (CSDC). My research is in the sub-fields on comparative and Canadian politics and focuses on the causes and consequences of political polarization and quantitative methodology. My current research is supported by the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada and the Fonds de recherche du Québec - Société et culture (FRQ-SC).
I previously revived a Bachelor’s degree in Political Science from Wilfrid Laurier University.

title: Rafael Campos-Gottardo
text: I am a Masters student in the political science department at McGill University and the Centre for the Study of Democratic Citizenship (CSDC). title: Conferences
text:
Papers
Erlich, A., Stolle, D., & Campos-Gottardo, R. (2024, June). Civic Engagement in Rebuilding Ukraine: Observational and Experimental Evidence. Paper presented at the Canadian Political Science Association’s Annual Conference, Montreal, QC.
Campos-Gottardo, R. & Kiss, S. (2024, June). Social Media Use and Polarization in Ontario: 2018 Case Study. Paper presented at the Canadian Political Science Association’s Annual Conference, Montreal, QC.
Campos-Gottardo, R. (2024, January). Correlates of Populist Attitudes in Canada: Evidence from the CES. Paper presented at the Bell Chair Graduate Student Conference, Ottawa, ON.
Paper Slides
Campos-Gottardo, R. (2022, August). Populism and authoritarianism during the COVID-19 pandemic: The case of Nayib Bukele in El Salvador. Paper presented at the annual Congress of the Canadian Association for Latin American and Caribbean Studies, Toronto, ON.
Slides


Posters
Campos-Gottardo, R. & Perrella, A. (2023, May). The Role of Populist Attitudes on Support for Centrist Populist Candidates: Evidence From El Salvador. Poster presented at the Canadian Political Science Association’s Annual Conference, Toronto, ON.
Poster
Campos-Gottardo, R., Jasemi, A., & Gottardo, A. (2022, June). Parenting beliefs about the importance of politics and child qualities: Similarities and differences across borders. Poster presented at Development 2022, Calgary, AB.
